awd_titl_txt: COCORP Seismic Reflection Exploration of the U.S.  -        Continental Lithosphere:  Buried Precambrian Interior,      Cratonic Moho, and Crustal Anisotropy
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides funds to continue COCORP's program of deep             seismic reflection investigation of the continental basement within             the United States.  Specifically, during this award period the main             activity will involve the acquisition of an experimental explosive              CMP profile within the Williston basin, the specific goal being to              characterize Moho and upper mantle reflectivity in the region, as               part of an ongoing effort to understand the origin of intracratonic             basins.  The broader goal is to test whether low-fold explosive                 profiling with "super multi-channel" receiver arrays can provide                a practical, and cost-effective means of imaging the lower crust                and upper mantle over wide regions of the cratons.  The project                 will involve Cornell personnel as well as key outside                           investigators.  The program will continue to take advantage of the              advanced capabilities of Amoco's SGR (Seismic Group Recorder) -                 equipped research seismic reflection crew, and for the first time               will involve collaboration with the U.S.G.S. for the collection of              explosive data.
